item.title: Not the brightest bulb (The Newsroom)
item.description: The Newsroom - Everywhere you look, people are telling you how to go green: Walk. Recycle. Compost. Turn off the water. Turn off the lights. But it looks like there's one place in America that didn't get the memo. The firehouse in Livermore, …

item.title: What Afghans think about President Obama’s troop drawdown (The Newsroom)
item.description: The Newsroom - Many Afghans have mixed feelings about tonight's announcement from President Obama that the US will begin drawing down the levels of troops in Afghanistan.

item.title: LIFE slideshow: Druids, mystery, faith, myth (The Newsroom)
item.description: The Newsroom - In early October, 2010, the ancient pagan tradition of Druidry was, for the first time, formally classed as a religion in Britain.

item.title: LIFE slideshow: NASA envisions alien worlds (The Newsroom)
item.description: The Newsroom - Captured by a camera or, as in this gallery, envisioned by artists, the far reaches of space continue to humble and amaze.

item.title: How the Dems toppled Weiner (The Newsroom)
item.description: The Newsroom - The sexting congressman refused to resign, but Nancy Pelosi had other ideas. Patricia Murphy on how the party leaders forced out the man who'd become a national embarrassment.

item.title: Ryan’s shrewd budget payday (The Newsroom)
item.description: The Newsroom - The congressman stands to make money from his stakes in four businesses that lease land to energy companies which would benefit from $45 billion in tax breaks and subsidies in his proposed budget. Daniel Stone reports.

item.title: Strawberry, chocolate, vanilla … cicada? (The Newsroom)
item.description: The Newsroom - If you're an adventurous diner, you might want to get yourself over to Sparky's Homemade Ice Cream in Columbia, Mo., to see if they have any leftover cicada ice cream. Yes, cicada as in the BUG. As in BUG ice …

item.title: US guns fuel Mexico drug war? The politics behind the issue. (The Newsroom)
item.description: The Newsroom - A new report shows that 70 percent of confiscated weapons submitted for tracing come from the US, but critics say the figure is politically motivated.

item.title: LIFE slideshow: WWII Allied bombers and crews (The Newsroom)
item.description: The Newsroom - Death from above, or the cavalry on wings ... regardless of which side you were on, there's no denying that bombers changed the face of warfare, and were an integral part of life on the front in World War II.

item.title: Readers respond: Can a gay judge rule on gay marriage? (The Newsroom)
item.description: The Newsroom - Today in what some call an unprecedented hearing in federal court, lawyers on both sides of the gay-rights spectrum presented their arguments on whether a gay marriage ruling by a gay judge in a long-term relationship needs to be thrown out because of a conflict of interest. As this case was before the court, Yahoo! News readers weighed in with opposing views that reflect the central arguments of the latest issue to arise in gay-rights court battles. <a href="http://blog.tools.news.yahoo. ...

item.title: The Palin emails: Media outlets want your help (The Newsroom)
item.description: The Newsroom - Alaska released more than 24,000 pages of email messages today from Sarah Palin's first 21 months as governor of the state. That's a lot of paper work to go through - six boxes and 100 pounds, to be exact.

item.title: Once in a blue lobster (The Newsroom)
item.description: The Newsroom - For one lucky lobster in the waters off Canada's Prince Edward Island, getting caught means a cushy aquarium tank, not a pot of boiling water. The clawed crustacean is getting the royal treatment because he's blue -- not sad blue, …

item.title: Michelle Obama: White House rebel (The Newsroom)
item.description: The Newsroom - Secret mall trips. Dining out incognito. Michelle Obama has constructed a life inside the bubble—and has her own sense of her 2012 role, Lois Romano reports in this week's Newsweek.

item.title: Breaking news: The latest from the newsroom (The Newsroom)
item.description: The Newsroom - Breaking news: The latest updates from the newsroom

item.title: LIFE slideshow: Before and after D-Day, in color (The Newsroom)
item.description: The Newsroom - It's no mystery why images of shocking, unremitting violence spring to mind when one hears the deceptively simple term, "D-Day."

item.title: Remembering 9/11: For 10-year anniversary, we want to hear from you (The Newsroom)
item.description: The Newsroom - This Sept. 11 will mark 10 years since the terrorist attacks in New York, Pennsylvania and Washington, D.C., killed nearly 3,000 people. To honor the anniversary, Yahoo! would like to hear your ideas and voices. We want to know what you want to read about - and we want to hear your story.

item.title: Bigfoot found in Solomon Islands! (The Newsroom)
item.description: The Newsroom - OK, maybe not THAT Bigfoot, but a guy with really, really big feet. Peter Iroga of the Solomon Islands tromps around on size 26 feet -- that's 14 inches, to the measurement-challenged -- which require custom-made kicks from the local …

item.title: Something borrowed, something Super Mario (The Newsroom)
item.description: The Newsroom - We've all been invited to (or thrown) theme parties before: the Disco party, Prom Night, '80s Dance parties. But have you ever been invited to a Super Mario Brothers' themed WEDDING? (Yes, you read that correctly: A WEDDING. Not a …

item.title: Missouri tornado: How to Help (The Newsroom)
item.description: The Newsroom - A massive tornado struck the small Missouri town of Joplin on May 22, killing more than 100 people. Hundreds more were injured and rescue teams are still searching the rubble for survivors. The massive twister destroyed an estimated 30 percent …

item.title: Angelman Syndrome: Close to a cure? (The Newsroom)
item.description: The Newsroom - Rebecca Burdine knew something was wrong the day her baby girl was born. Sophie was born without a natural sucking reflex, making it nearly impossible to eat. Later, it became clear that she had hardly any muscle strength at all. …
